title: Lockheed Martin offers to acquire Terran Orbital
summary: Lockheed Martin has proposed acquiring smallsat manufacturer Terran Orbital, which it already owns a stake in and does business with, for more than $500 million.

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX launching three Falcon 9 rockets including Crew-8; new launcher to debut from Japan
summary: This week now has four flights scheduled, starting with Crew-8, which is to send a new crew to the International Space Station for a six-month tour of duty after launching from Florida. Starlink 6-41 from Cape Canaveral and Transporter 10 from Vandenberg Space Force Base are also on the docket along with the debut of a new small satellite launcher from Japan.

title: NASA cancels OSAM-1 satellite servicing technology mission
summary: NASA has canceled a multibillion-dollar project to demonstrate satellite servicing technologies that had suffered extensive delays and cost overruns.

title: Boeing gets $439 million contract for U.S. military communications satellite
summary: The contract is for the WGS-12 Wideband Global Satcom geostationary satellite

title: Lockheed Martin looks to acquire spacecraft maker Terran Orbital for nearly $600 million
summary: Lockheed Martin submitted a bid to acquire spacecraft manufacturer Terran Orbital, the defense giant revealed in a securities filing on Friday.

title: NASA shuts down $2 billion satellite refueling project after Maxar is cited for poor performance
summary: NASA is shutting down a $2 billion project to test satellite refueling in space, it announced on Friday, after the agency’s auditor criticized the program’s lead contractor Maxar for poor performance.

title: Webinar – Beyond Earth: Blueprint for SMB Innovation
summary: Date: March 14th, 2024Time: 1 PM ET Join us on Thursday, March 14, 2024 as SpaceNews host Matt Adelhorn discusses Dassault Systèmes Blueprint for SMB Innovation with Jason Roberson and […]

title: SpaceX sends 23 more Starlink satellites into orbit on Leap Day
summary: SpaceX sent 23 more Starlink high-speed internet satellites into orbit on Leap Day. The satellites were launched from a SpaceX Falcon 9...

title: MSR problems illustrative of challenges for NASA flagship missions, audit concludes
summary: As decision loom about its funding and architecture, a NASA review about the Mars Sample Return (MSR) program concluded its problems illustrate ongoing challenges the agency has managing large missions.

title: Daily Telescope: Two nebulae in Orion for the price of one
summary: What happens if you observe the same patch of sky every night all winter?
